description: Return the first element in the array whose frequency count is unique (not shared by any other element's frequency).

testCases.explanation: Frequencies: 1->2, 2->1, 3->2. Only 2 has frequency 1 which is unique. First element with unique freq is 2.
Frequencies: 1->1, 2->2, 3->3. All frequencies are unique. First element by order of first appearance is 1.
Single element with frequency 1, which is trivially unique.
Frequencies: 4->3, 2->2, 1->1. All frequencies unique; 4 appears first but 1 is at position 5; first element in array order with unique freq: 4 has freq 3 (unique), so answer is 4.
Frequencies: 1->2, 2->2, 3->1. Freq 2 is shared; only 3 has unique frequency 1. First element with unique freq is 3.
